title: Courtesy titles
description: Avoid Mr., Ms., Mrs. in most contexts per AP.

title: Time format
description: Use a.m./p.m. with periods; omit :00 (7 p.m., not 7:00 PM).

title: Numbers 1-9 spelled out
description: Spell out one through nine; use figures for 10 and above.

title: Percent sign
description: Use % with a figure (e.g., 5%).

title: Serial comma (Oxford)
description: Generally avoid the Oxford comma unless needed for clarity.

title: Dates: no ordinal suffix
description: Write Sept. 5, not September 5th.

title: Months: correct abbreviations
description: Abbreviate Jan., Feb., Aug., Sept., Oct., Nov., Dec. with a date; do not abbreviate March, April, May, June, July.

title: States in body text
description: Spell out state names in body text; avoid postal codes.

title: No comma before Jr./Sr.
description: Do not use a comma before Jr. or Sr.

title: U.S. abbreviation
description: Use U.S. (with periods) as a noun or adjective.

title: OK vs. Okay
description: Use OK, OK'd; avoid Okay in AP style.

title: email vs. e-mail
description: Use email, not e-mail.

title: website vs. Web site
description: Use website (one word, lowercase), not Web site.

title: internet lowercase
description: Use internet (lowercase).

title: Ages: figures; hyphenate before noun
description: Always use figures for ages; hyphenate as adjective (a 5-year-old boy).

title: Dimensions and sizes
description: Use figures and hyphenate adjectival forms (a 9-by-12 rug).

title: Money format
description: Use $ with figures; prefer $3 million over 3 million dollars.

title: Time ranges format
description: Use 'from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.'; avoid 10am-2pm and en dashes without spaces.

title: Single space after period
description: Use one space after a period.

title: toward, not towards
description: Use toward (not towards).

title: health care two words
description: Use health care (two words).

title: mph lowercase
description: Use mph (lowercase).

title: Decades style
description: Use 1980s or '80s; avoid 1980's or 80's.

title: Midnight notation
description: Use midnight, not 12 a.m.

title: Noon notation
description: Use noon, not 12 p.m.

title: Comma in full dates
description: Use a comma in full dates: Sept. 5, 2025. Flag missing comma.

title: No leading zero in dates
description: Avoid leading zeros in dates (Sept. 05).

title: No hyphen after -ly adverbs
description: Do not hyphenate after adverbs ending in -ly.

title: Spell out simple fractions
description: Spell out simple fractions under 1 (two-thirds), avoid 2/3 in narrative.

title: City/state postal codes
description: Avoid postal abbreviations with city names in narrative (use Maryland, not MD).

title: Titles of works in quotes
description: Put composition titles (books, movies, songs) in quotation marks; newspapers and magazines take no quotes or italics.
